resources.string: This little app will temporarily turn off screen backlight without putting phone to sleep.
To turn on the screen again, you can either click on the notification or simply press the power button to lock phone then unlock it
Free license (If you donated and the app do not recognise, please restart the app)
A screenfilter like method, which darken the screen without touching the hardware (also affect external picture)
How low this method should lower the screen brightness
(Advanced) Broadcast an intent when MHL/HDMI connects
(Advanced) Broadcast an intent when MHL/HDMI disconnects
Specify an intent action (Note: intent is always case-sensitive. An example: com.myintent.AwesomeAction)
Shaking during screen off toggle between complete and low brightness
Choose how sensitive should the program react to your shake
Most popular and should be enabled for all devices
Must be enabled for AMOLED devices (Galaxy S2, S3, etc). Other device may also benefit. This method has no effect to Nexus and some HTC devices.

May solve problem with Galaxy S3 users. May also help if you have problem turning screen back on. Please note that this is the voltage cut method, which may be dangerous and should only be used if other methods is not working. The app will attempt to restore the minimum voltage that can support the screen to avoid any damage to hardware
Native linux method of cutting screen backlight. Pretty slow and should be enabled only if other methods fail to work
[To be implemented] Check for new version
Prevent screen from going to sleep during screen off
Prevent wifi from being disconnected during screen off
If auto-brightness is enabled, the app will change it to manual mode during screen off and toggle it back to auto-brightness when the screen is on again
Touchscreen will be temporarily disabled during screen off. Note that statusbar will still be active.
Enable ads to support further development of the app. :) It will not be too annoying
From main window, pressing turn off backlight will then return to home screen automatically
Hover your hand on the sensor to toggle screen off / low brightness
Configure how proximity sensor should toggle screen on/off
First press with put a notification. Then press the notification to turn off screen (great for navigating to other app before off screen)
(Experimental) Auto screen off when a selected app is brought to front and screen on when the app is suspended / killed
Auto screen off when a headphone/earphone is plugged into the device and screen on after unplugging the cable
Select an app to run when headset is inserted
Close app as headset is removed
Automatically close selected app as headset is disconnected
Return to home screen upon headset disconnection
Auto screen off when HDMI/MHL is plugged and screen on after unplugging the cable
Let the trigger notification persistent until you manually clear it
Change brightness of button backlight as well as screen backlight. May cause flickering in button backlight in some devices
Select an app to run when HDMI cable connects
Auto screen off / on upon insertion and removal of USB accessories
If specified, bluetooth detector will only react to device(s) whose name contains the string (case-insensitive). Leave blank to watch for any device
Auto screen on / off when a Bluetooth device is connected/paired and disconnected/unpaired
Run app on Bluetooth connection / pairing
Select an app to run upon Bluetooth device connection / pairing
Close app upon Bluetooth device disconnection / unpairing
Automatically close selected app as Bluetooth is disconnected / unpaired
Return to home screen upon Bluetooth disconnection / unpairing
Auto screen on / off when device is inserted into and removed from dock
Select an app to run when Dock connect
Automatically close selected app as device is undocked
Return to home screen upon Dock removal
Turn off screen when device is inserted in a car dock
Turn off screen when device is inserted in a desktop dock
Turn off screen when device is inserted in an analog dock
Turn off screen when device is inserted in a digital dock
Turn on screen again when device is removed from any dock
Automatically close selected app as HDMI disconnect
Return to home screen upon HDMI disconnection
Enable compatibility mode for Atrix proprietary docks. Should be enabled only for Atrix/Atrix 2 devices.
Screen off when device is inserted in Motorola Atrix Lapdock.
Screen off when device is inserted in Motorola Atrix HD dock.
(Experimental!) Device\'s screen will function as a touchpad during screen off. A mouse pointer will float on display
If enabled, use a black mouse pointer instead of a white one
Clear every saved preferences back to their default values.\nRecommended if you have force closes or other problems.
Capture every event happened when you use the app (not capturing system events).
If enabled, the right and bottom sides of touchpad will enable Vertical and Horizontal scrolling respectively
Select how big is the scrolling area

This feature will take part of the screen width and height and change them into scrolling area. Please note that for the FIRST time you use the feature, the soft-keyboard may not show up when you want to type something. It is normal. To enable it, click on \"Input method\" icon on your status bar and turn \"off\" hardware keyboard
For device having on-screen navigation keys (like Galaxy Nexus / Nexus 7), allow mouse pointer to click on those keys
Choose how sensitive should the device detect facing down
Choose how sensitive should the device detect being held bottom up
If you have problem, follow below procedures to make the app works on your device
1. Screen turn on unexpectedly / Device freeze or Youtube / Netflix / Video player show a blank frame?

A temporary fix can be done as follow: \n1) Go to device\'s \"Settings\" - \"Development settings\"\n2) Tick on \"Disable HW Overlay\" (if you can\'t find the option, it may be hidden under Advanced section)
2. Are you Rooted and has BusyBox installed?

Make sure that your device is rooted and has the latest version of BusyBox binary installed. Restart the device after installing busybox if necessary. To install busybox, you can hope on Play Store and install a Busybox Installer or simply click on following button

Clearing app data may help if the app worked before but not anymore. Especially if you made some change in settings or upgraded from old version. Please note that by clearing app data, all of your configurations are reseted to default

If you can\'t still make it run, please generate a log and report bug to developer. You have support from a dedicated developer and development community. Hope to Settings then select \"Enable extensive log\" at the bottom. Run the app, try to recreate the problem. Then go to the app interface, \"Menu\" - \"Print debug info\". Post a log over my email (android@nkahnt.com) or on XDA development thread.
5. Download and try a beta version
Beta versions are constantly developed and released. Try one of the latest beta and see if it works for your device?
Turn screen on upon incoming call then back to previous value when call ends
Screen off automatically activates after a defined amount of inactivity

If this mode is enabled, screen will NOT turn off immediately. Instead, it waits for a defined amount of idling time (no user interaction) then shut the screen off. To turn on the screen again, simply tap the screen or other temporary method if enabled (i.e shaking).
Set amount of inactivity time to start screen off
If enabled, app will hide status bar whenever one two dim turns screen off
If enabled, One Two Dimmer will survive after screen lock / unlock
If enabled, One Two Dimmer will automatically started when device boot (Survive screen lock must be enabled to use this)
If enabled, zero brightness method will take less time to detect brightness devices. However the option may not work on some devices
Configure and tweak several methods the app uses to turn off device screen
Configure shaking / auto face down feature
Turn off screen when device is held upside down, turn on when device is held normally (Experimental feature)
Turn off screen when device is facing down, turn on when device is facing up (Experimental feature)
Backup all of your settings to external storage
Is this device the receiver or controller?
Allow using media buttons (i.e headset buttons or hardware buttons) to toggle screen on, off
Allow using volume up, down keys to toggle screen on, off
Set how volume keys should be responsible for screen on, off

string-array.name: pref_volumekey_toggle_type_names
string-array.item: Vol up: screen on/Vol down : screen off
Vol up: screen off/Vol down : screen on

resources.string: Volume key detection compatibility mode with x86, MIPS architecture (use this if normal volume key detection does not work). Not as efficient as normal detection method
Clicking on headset button will toggle screen on, off
Clicking on hardware media buttons (play/stop/back/next/etc) will toggle screen on, off

string-array.name: pref_proximity_toggle_type_names
string-array.item: Hover hand to circle between screen on and off
Hover hand: screen on. Hand moves out: screen off
Hover hand: screen off. Hand moves out: screen on

resources.string: Click to save app\'s debug information to storage and show option to directly send log to developer\'s email
Please follow the wizard to optimise Screen Standby to best suit your device and use case
You can run this wizard again at any time from the app\'s settings
Please select your device and your main purpose of using Screen Standby. The wizard will then select the best settings to your scenario
It is recommended that you enable "Disable Hardware Overlay" in Android\'s Settings -> Developer options to prevent problems
You need root and busybox installed on your device. You can skip this step if you have already rooted and installed busybox on your device
Here is the summary of what the wizard will perform
If enabled, screen standby will continue to function after a true device screen lock
Run the wizard to automatically set optimised settings according to your device and use-case
Overwrite system timeout to prevent device from going to sleep

If enabled, you can assign a \'quick dial\' number to perform an action (launch Screen Standby, toggle screen on/off or launch other app). Simply make a call to that number in your phone dialer to execute the task
This method wil attempt to cut power supply to your device built-in panel, providing true screen off and is the most efficient method. However, your device may not be compatible with this
